item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Chassis :: Ambient Critical Threshold Temperature
item_prototype.description: "The value of this object is temperature in degrees C"

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Chassis :: Ambient Temperature
item_prototype.description: "The value of this object is temperature in degrees C"

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Chassis :: Ambient Warning Threshold Temperature
item_prototype.description: "The value of this object is temperature in degrees C"

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Chassis :: Health Status
item_prototype.description: "The value of this object is determinted by the severity of the health condition state variables. The most severe state will be reflected."

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Disk :: Number of Disks
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the number of disk installed in the array."

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Disk :: Total Storage
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the total disk storage in MBs on the array."

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: Media :: RAID Status
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the status of the raid subsystem. This is a composite of the view of the underlying subsystems. Status ok means things are ok. Status degraded means we are in a degraded state, possible because no spare is available. Status verifying means a verify pass is run, and a percent complete is available. Status reconstructing means we are reconstructing a drive and a percent complete is available. Status failed means we had a failure while we were up, possibly a drive failed and we have no spare. Status catastrophicLoss may not be visible to the user since the member may not be able to bootup. It means we need administrator intervention to correct the problem. Status mirroring means we are mirroring a bad drive onto a spare drive. "

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: SYSTEM :: Battery status Controller 1
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the status of the raid subsystem. This is a composite of the view of the underlying subsystems. Status ok means things are ok. Status degraded means we are in a degraded state, possible because no spare is available. Status verifying means a verify pass is run, and a percent complete is available. Status reconstructing means we are reconstructing a drive and a percent complete is available. Status failed means we had a failure while we were up, possibly a drive failed and we have no spare. Status catastrophicLoss may not be visible to the user since the member may not be able to bootup. It means we need administrator intervention to correct the problem. Status mirroring means we are mirroring a bad drive onto a spare drive. "

item_prototype.name: SYSTEM :: {#SNMPVALUE} :: SYSTEM :: Battery status Controller 2
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the status of the raid subsystem. This is a composite of the view of the underlying subsystems. Status ok means things are ok. Status degraded means we are in a degraded state, possible because no spare is available. Status verifying means a verify pass is run, and a percent complete is available. Status reconstructing means we are reconstructing a drive and a percent complete is available. Status failed means we had a failure while we were up, possibly a drive failed and we have no spare. Status catastrophicLoss may not be visible to the user since the member may not be able to bootup. It means we need administrator intervention to correct the problem. Status mirroring means we are mirroring a bad drive onto a spare drive. "

item_prototype.name: Volume Replication Site IP Address
item_prototype.description: "The total amount of pool space reserved for use by the site. Replication may be set up as needed by the administrators at the site as long as the total required reserve does not exceed this value."

item_prototype.name: Volume Replication Site Left in Percentages
Volume Replication Site Name
item_prototype.description: "The total amount of pool space reserved for use by the site. Replication may be set up as needed by the administrators at the site as long as the total required reserve does not exceed this value."

item_prototype.name: Volume Replication Site Space Allocated
item_prototype.description: "The total amount of pool space reserved for use by the site. Replication may be set up as needed by the administrators at the site as long as the total required reserve does not exceed this value."

item_prototype.name: Volume Replication Site Used in Percentages
{#SNMPVALUE} Admin Status
item_prototype.description:
INTEGER { online ( 1 ) , offline ( 2 ) , online-lost-cached-blocks ( 3 ) , online-control ( 4 ) , offline-control ( 5 ) }
"This field specifies if the volume is set to online or offline by the administrator. If a volume is offline, it cannot be accessed by iscsi initiators. When lost blocks that belong to a particular volume are found, the operational status of the volume is set to not-available-due-to-lost-cached-blocks. When the volume is in this state, If the user chooses to ignore the lost blocks by setting the volume status to online, the admin status is automatically set to online-lost-cached-blocks by the subsystem. The online-lost-cached-blocks state of admin status conveys the fact that user acknowledged and acted up on the lost-blocks state of the volume. Upon reboot, when the subsystem finds a volume with adminstatus as online-lost-cached-blocks , it sets the oper status to online instead of not-available-due-to-lost-cached-blocks as the user already acknowledged the lost-blocks and choose to ignore them."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Number of Replicas
item_prototype.description: " The value of this object represents the total number of replicas present for this volume across all replica sites. The value will match with the sum of values of eqliscsiVolumeReplNumReplicas that correspond to this volume."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Number of Snapshots
item_prototype.description: "Indicates the number of snapshots that the system is maintaining on the specified volume"

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Snapshots reserve
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies how many MB of space is reserved for snapshots of this volume. This is a dynamic value, it is not Administrator setable."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Snapshot Warning Level
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies when to warn the Administrator that the space reserved for SnapShots. The warning is sent when the SnapShot Space available drops below the specified percentage. The default is 20 percent."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Snapshot Warning Level Reversed
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies when to warn the Administrator that the space reserved for SnapShots. The warning is sent when the SnapShot Space available drops below the specified percentage. The default is 20 percent."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Space Borrowed for Snapshots
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies how many MB of space that this volume is borrowing."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Space Used for Snapshots
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies how many MB of reserved space that is unused by the snapshots."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Thin Provisioning Minimal Reserve
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the amount of pool free space that is currently reserved for this Thin Provisioned Volume configured as percentage of eqliscsiVolumeSize."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Thin Provisioning Warning Level
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the percentage of Advertised Size for which we send a WARNING Message when the Allocated Volume Size reaches it. Default value is eqlGroupDefaultThinWarn."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Volume Allocated Space
item_prototype.description: " The value of this object represents the actual materialized pages for this volume. "

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Volume Borrowed Space Status
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies operational status of borrowing."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Volume Size
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies the volume size in MB. There is no default. Note: Volume size is round to a multiple of 15MB. For thin provisioned volumes this value represents the advertized size of the volume and eqliscsiVolumeMinThinReserve represents the actual reserved size."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Volume Snapshot Reserve (% of volume reserve)
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies what percentage of the volumesize will be reserved for SnapShots. This space is reserved in addition to the space reserved for the volume. The default is 100 percent."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} Volume Thin Provision
item_prototype.description: "This field specifies when to warn the Administrator that the space reserved for SnapShots. The warning is sent when the SnapShot Space available drops below the specified percentage. The default is 20 percent."

trigger_prototype.name: In-use space exceed the warning limit ({#SNMPINDEX})

graph_prototype.name: Thin Provisioning :: {#SNMPINDEX} Volume Size in Percentages
